page.title: 16THE GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA
page.content: There are quite a lot of rivers around Dalmally, like the River Orchy which flows into Loch Awe. Altogether it is 31 kilometres long. There is also the River Strae which is 13 kilometres long. The most notable features of the area are the mountains. Ben Cruachan is the highest it is 1126metres on one peak and 1101metres on its second peak. The second highest peak is Ben Eunaich at 988 metres and slightly smaller, Ben a Chochill at 980 metres,also there is Ben a Bhuiridh at 896 metres. All of these mountains are on the north shore of Loch Awe.
